fi.lrkr.twos.game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.lrkr.twos.game.Board

  • public class Board
extends Object
    Class provides the game board's functionality.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Constructor for creating Board with default values.
      Board(int y, int x, int startNumber)
      Constructor for creating Board object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNew()
      Adds a new Piece to a random empty location on the Board.
      Piece[][] getBoard() 
      int[][] getBoardValues()
      Copies Board's Pieces' values to a 2d array.
      int getHeight() 
      int getWidth() 
      void init()
      Initializes the board with 0 value pieces.
      int moveDown()
      Moves all the Pieces on the Board to down, combines suitable Pieces and counts score for the move.
      int moveLeft()
      Moves all the Pieces on the Board to left, combines suitable Pieces and counts score for the move.
      int moveRight()
      Moves all the Pieces on the Board to right, combines suitable Pieces and counts score for the move.
      int moveUp()
      Moves all the Pieces on the Board to up, combines suitable Pieces and counts score for the move.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor for creating Board with default values.

      • Board

        public Board(int y,
             int x,
             int startNumber)
        Constructor for creating Board object.
        Parameters:
        y - Board's height
        x - Board's width
        startNumber - Initial Piece value

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the board with 0 value pieces.

      • addNew

        public void addNew()
        Adds a new Piece to a random empty location on the Board. The added Piece's value might be randomly doubled.

      • getBoardValues

        public int[][] getBoardValues()
        Copies Board's Pieces' values to a 2d array.
        Returns:
        2d int array of Board's Pieces' values.

      • moveLeft

        public int moveLeft()
        Moves all the Pieces on the Board to left, combines suitable Pieces and counts score for the move.
        Returns:
        Score of the move.

      • moveRight

        public int moveRight()
        Moves all the Pieces on the Board to right, combines suitable Pieces and counts score for the move.
        Returns:
        Score of the move.

      • moveUp

        public int moveUp()
        Moves all the Pieces on the Board to up, combines suitable Pieces and counts score for the move.
        Returns:
        Score of the move.

      • moveDown

        public int moveDown()
        Moves all the Pieces on the Board to down, combines suitable Pieces and counts score for the move.
        Returns:
        Score of the move.

      • getBoard

        public Piece[][] getBoard()

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
